decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of aggressive creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By including the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring, the deck gains access to additional mana ramp and color fixing. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Orcish Bowmasters provide strong creatures for early aggression, while Goblin Bombardment and Lightning Bolt offer direct damage options. Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help control the opponent's board, while Static Prison and Ob Nixilis, the Adversary disrupt their strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and efficiency in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to use a toolbox of creatures to set up and execute powerful combos. By utilizing creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide along with Chord of Calling to fetch specific creatures as needed, the deck aims to control the board while draining the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Zulaport Cutthroat helps to further amplify the deck's ability to drain life and win the game through a combination of creature synergy and combo plays.

The deck revolves around utilizing Merfolk creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and disruptive abilities. By using cards like Aether Vial to quickly deploy creatures and Lord of Atlantis to boost their power, the deck aims to establish early board presence and apply pressure. Cards like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation offer protection and disruption against opposing strategies, while cards like Sink into Stupor and Spreading Seas provide additional disruption and control elements. The deck's key strategy is to out-tempo and out-value the opponent with a cohesive Merfolk tribal theme.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly cascade into powerful spells like Crashing Footfalls and LÃ³rien Revealed, while utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Brazen Borrower for additional value. Teferi, Time Raveler is included to disrupt opponents' strategies and Leyline Binding helps control the board. The deck also includes a mix of lands to support its mana base and ensure smooth gameplay. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy that takes advantage of the cascade mechanic.

The deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. Atraxa, Grand Unifier helps to protect and boost the creatures, while Fallaji Archaeologist and Psychic Frog provide additional graveyard manipulation. The deck also includes disruption with Force of Negation and Thoughtseize. Leyline Binding helps to control the board, while Tainted Indulgence provides card advantage. The deck aims to quickly reanimate big threats like Ulamog, the Defiler and Griselbrand, overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence.

This Naya Zoo deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays by utilizing low-cost creatures like Renegade Rallier and Amped Raptor to deal damage quickly. It also includes control elements like Static Prison to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck includes utility cards like Saffi Eriksdotter and Extraction Specialist to protect key creatures and remove threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast-paced, efficient aggro strategy while maintaining some level of control over the board.

The deck revolves around playing aggressive creatures and utilizing powerful spells to quickly bring down the opponent's life total. The presence of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring allows for additional mana ramp and fixing. The deck focuses on a diverse array of creature types to maximize the potential of cards like Tribal Flames and Leyline of the Guildpact. Stubborn Denial provides protection for key threats, while Lightning Bolt acts as versatile removal. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and to ensure consistent performance.

The deck focuses on creating infinite combos using Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai to generate infinite tokens. This can be complemented by powerful payoffs like Solitude and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The deck also uses cards like Ice-Fang Coatl and Wrenn and Six for value and control. The mana base is designed to support these combos with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with an unstoppable board presence.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by using a variety of counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck also utilizes card draw and graveyard recursion to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. Additionally, there are a few powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The lands in the deck provide the necessary mana base to support the control strategy and allow for flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas provide threats while Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to establish board control and card advantage, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with efficient spellcasting and powerful creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to adapt to a variety of situations and matchups.

This deck aims to generate mana quickly with rituals and medallions, and then use Ral, Monsoon Mage's abilities to deal damage and dig for combo pieces. The deck utilizes spells like Wish and Past in Flames to play cards from the sideboard or graveyard repeatedly, while cards like Valakut Awakening and Reckless Impulse help filter through the deck for key components. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion to add an extra layer of consistency to the deck. The goal is to storm off and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and burn damage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing big red creatures and spells to deal damage to opponents and disrupt their strategies. The key strategy involves playing powerful cards like Boros Reckoner, Screaming Nemesis, and Seasoned Pyromancer to maintain board control. Cards like Stuffy Doll and Ensnaring Bridge are used to prevent opponents from attacking. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Skred, Lightning Bolt, and Flame Slash to deal damage to creatures or players. Blood Moon disrupts opponents' mana bases, while Valakut Awakening provides card advantage. Snow-Covered Mountains and Scrying Sheets provide mana fixing and card draw options.
